thread.title: Lars Ulrich: What My Dad Thought Of 'Hardwired... To Self-Destruct' [News]
thread.title_full: Lars Ulrich: What My Dad Thought Of 'Hardwired... To Self-Destruct' [News]

title: Lars Ulrich: What My Dad Thought Of 'Hardwired... To Self-Destruct' [News]
text:
UG News editor since early 2013. King Crimson fan. I handle the news around here. Posted 3 hours ago 10 
Lars Ulrich recently discussed his dad's reaction to the latest Metallica album " Hardwired... To Self-Destruct ." 
As you may or may not know, Lars' dad is Torben Ulrich, an 88-year-old retired tennis player known to some fans for his "delete that" comment during " St. Anger " recording sessions. 
Anyhow, the drummer told RUM Entertainment : "[Laughs] I played him the first two songs a couple of months back and he dug it; he was very into it, he thought it sounded very much like Metallica. And then I had the office send [the album] over to him... "I saw him for Thanksgiving dinner and he unprovoked - unprovoked! - started talking to me about how awesome the record was. I got more positive vibes out of him than I have for any Metallica record for quite some time. 
"He got it on CD and he asked if he could also have - [laughs] he's 88 years old! - he's got an iPod now and he asked if he could have it in digital form. So I'll take that as a good sign. The days of 'delete that' are over, at least on this record."
